did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Paula Morin collection: Honest horses, wild horses in the Great Basin, 1999-2001
did.physdesc: 21 photographic prints (giclee prints, handcolored) : inkjet, color ; various sizes.

corpname.part: Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Collection of photographic documentation of wild horse herds in the Nevada Great Basin made by Paula Morin during her work for the Nevada Arts Council, 1999-2001. The photographs were exhibited by the Nevada Arts Council in an exhibiton titled, "Honest Horses: A Portrait of the Mustang in Nevada's Great Basin." The collection includes 21 prints described by the artist as giclee prints made from handpainted black-and-white photographs; one print log, and related publicity materials.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

title.part: Honest horses, wild horses in the Great Basin

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into two series: Manuscripts and graphic images. The negatives and contact sheets are in a binder, described as Box 2 in the container list.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Paula Morin collection was purchased by the American Folklife Center in 2013.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Valda Morris processed and encoded the collection finding aid in EAD format in April 2014.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related interviews conducted by Paula Morin for the exhibition are in the Nevada Arts Council "Honest Horses" exhibition collection (AFC 2014/019).

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Duplication of collection materials may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Paula Morin collection: Honest horses, wild horses in the Great Basin (AFC 2013/038), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bibliography.head: Publication
bibliography.bibref:
Morin, Paula.
Honest horses : wild horses in the Great Basin
(Reno: University of Nevada Press, c2006)

bioghist.head: Biographical Notes
bioghist.p: Paula Morin is a photographer and oral historian specializing in the photography of wild horses of the Great Basin region of the American West. For more than a decade, she has studied wild horses and conducted interviews about the horses' impact on the ecology and cultural landscape of Nevada.

Born in Hollywood, California, and raised in San Francisco, Morin’s admiration for horses was first inspired by her father, who was raised in Montana. They attended many horse races and polo matches during her childhood. Morin graduated magna cum laude from Southern Oregon University and later pursued post-graduate studies in photographic history and cultural anthropology. She became an independent photographer and field researcher and pursued an interest in the nineteenth-century technique of hand-painted black-and-white photography.

In 1999, Morin received a Rural Community Arts Assistance Grant from the National Endowment for the Arts and the U.S. Forest Service which resulted in the exhibition Honest Horses: A Portrait of the Mustang in Nevada's Great Basin, supported by the Nevada Arts Council.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection of photographic documentation of wild horse herds in the Nevada Great Basin made by Paula Morin during her work for the Nevada Arts Council, 1999-2001.

The manuscript materials include exhibition documentation, a narrative history of wild horses in the Great Basin, background information on the Nevada Touring Initiative, and a teaching module. Also included is a handwritten print log with details about the creation of the giclee prints.
The graphic images include 21 giclee prints, plus more than 1300 black-and-white photographs depicting wild horses in the Great Basin region, as well as other images taken during Morin's fieldwork.
Administratrive information pertaining to the Nevada Touring Initiative.
Postcards, flyers, book jackets and schedule of exhibits.
Telling the Story of Nevada's Wild Horses State Spotlight: National Assembly of State Arts Agencies
Detailed processing and image development notes.
